commit_message:
Skips kubernetes service without selector

When a service is defined without a selector, Kubernetes does not
create an endpoint object for it. This patch includes a pre-checking
at the LBaaSSpecHandler on_present to skip this service.

Change-Id: Ic5a9610175c0bf35664781c23f674c8c890e85f9
Closes-Bug: 1697942
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/91/483891/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: m_handler._should_ignore.return_value = False m_handler._should_ignore.return_value = False def test_on_present_no_selector(self): svc_event = mock.sentinel.svc_event old_spec = mock.sentinel.old_spec m_handler = mock.Mock(spec=h_lbaas.LBaaSSpecHandler) m_handler._get_lbaas_spec.return_value = old_spec m_handler._should_ignore.return_value = True h_lbaas.LBaaSSpecHandler.on_present(m_handler, svc_event) m_handler._get_lbaas_spec.assert_called_once_with(svc_event) m_handler._has_lbaas_spec_changes.assert_not_called() m_handler._generate_lbaas_spec.assert_not_called() m_handler._set_lbaas_spec.assert_not_called()

commit_message:
Fix 'domain' filter not work well in some commands

The 'domain' filter not work well in commands 'project show',
'user show' and 'user set'.

Depends-On: I490900d6249f01654d4cba43bddd3e7af7928a84
Closes-Bug: #1704097
Change-Id: Ib4f47cbaba27eb56c4a41d187fee74a995e62dc7

commit_message:
Revert service name change

[1] got merged but changed how Service Name
and extension were being treated, resulting in [2].
This fixes the issue.

[1]: I6faf26d263788d21da078e570487ee4876d04efd
[2]: I677721aeada6fd74e8201c7f308771c887b2a1e9

Change-Id: I54ead7d5bff3a0b353fd4407d3c060bb6a7b8700

commit_message:
Use URIOpt

Replace StrOpt with URIOpt.
But 'serial_port_service_uri' in nova/conf/vmware.py
is excluded because it can be non URI format(*1).

*1: https://github.com/openstack/vmware-vspc/blob/master/README.rst

Change-Id: I595c55798b482009c42261c3603a58f82e89877c
Closes-Bug: #1599034

subject: Handle rehome of firewall exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-28 03:40:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/116eebae32afcab997b310207677af5dd1cc202f', 'message': 'Move Firewall Exceptions to a common location

As firewall starts to use the neutron-lib definitions,
there is no point of maintaining similar exception classes
in the different firewall extensions. This patch brings
together all exceptions in a single location, thus allowing easier
modifications and understanding of the exceptions used in firewalls.

Change-Id: I5c7cc3a0f4acb809f333bcdf41e3b3d156f42492
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-29 04:25:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/e5bd6ca47ba67a6edd1be1865741616953d2dd74', 'message': 'Handle rehome of firewall exceptions

Firewall exceptions have been rehomed to neutron-lib
in [1] and this patch is its corresponding change in neutron-fwaas.

[1]: Ie54ac5303020ea1db49ee5c2c6aaab4dd8e4c790

commit_message:
Handle rehome of firewall exceptions

Firewall exceptions have been rehomed to neutron-lib
in [1] and this patch is its corresponding change in neutron-fwaas.

[1]: Ie54ac5303020ea1db49ee5c2c6aaab4dd8e4c790

Change-Id: I5c7cc3a0f4acb809f333bcdf41e3b3d156f42492
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/63/478363/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_fwaas.common import exceptions as f_exc except f_exc.FirewallNotFound: raise f_exc.FirewallInPendingState(firewall_id=firewall_id, pending_state=fwall['status'])

commit_message:
VNX: Add QoS support

This patch adds QoS support by leveraging the NQM on the VNX.

The supported qos specs are:
* maxBWS, maximum bandwidth in MiB
* maxIOPS, maximum IOPS

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint add-vnx-qos-support
Change-Id: Iec7ce170e152bff0429de1922b9ccc26822007c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/86/441786/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tier, cg_id=None, ignore_thresholds=False, ioclasses=None): if ioclasses: policy, is_new = self.get_running_policy() for one in ioclasses: one.add_lun(lun) policy.add_class(one) if is_new: policy.run_policy() def get_ioclass(self, qos_specs): ioclasses = [] if qos_specs is not None: prefix = qos_specs['id'] max_bws = qos_specs[common.QOS_MAX_BWS] max_iops = qos_specs[common.QOS_MAX_IOPS] if max_bws: name = '{}-{}-{}'.format(prefix, 'bws', max_bws) class_bws = self.vnx.get_ioclass(name=name) if not class_bws.existed: class_bws = self.create_ioclass_bws(name, max_bws) ioclasses.append(class_bws) if max_iops: name = '{}-{}-{}'.format(prefix, 'iops', max_iops) class_iops = self.vnx.get_ioclass(name=name) if not class_iops.existed: class_iops = self.create_ioclass_iops(name, max_iops) ioclasses.append(class_iops) return ioclasses def create_ioclass_iops(self, name, max_iops): """Creates a ioclass by IOPS.""" max_iops = int(max_iops) ctrl_method = storops.VNXCtrlMethod( method=storops.VNXCtrlMethod.LIMIT_CTRL, metric='tt', value=max_iops) ioclass = self.vnx.create_ioclass(name=name, iotype='rw', ctrlmethod=ctrl_method) return ioclass def create_ioclass_bws(self, name, max_bws): """Creates a ioclass by bandwidth in MiB.""" max_bws = int(max_bws) ctrl_method = storops.VNXCtrlMethod( method=storops.VNXCtrlMethod.LIMIT_CTRL, metric='bw', value=max_bws) ioclass = self.vnx.create_ioclass(name=name, iotype='rw', ctrlmethod=ctrl_method) return ioclass def create_policy(self, policy_name): """Creates the policy and starts it.""" policy = self.vnx.get_policy(name=policy_name) if not policy.existed: LOG.info(_LI('Creating the policy: %s'), policy_name) policy = self.vnx.create_policy(name=policy_name) return policy def get_running_policy(self): """Returns the only running/measuring policy on VNX. .. note: VNX only allows one running policy. """ policies = self.vnx.get_policy() policies = list(filter(lambda p: p.state == "Running" or p.state == "Measuring", policies)) if len(policies) >= 1: return policies[0], False else: return self.create_policy("vnx_policy"), True def add_lun_to_ioclass(self, ioclass_name, lun_id): ioclass = self.vnx.get_ioclass(name=ioclass_name) ioclass.add_lun(lun_id)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-19 08:39:13.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/profiles/os/nova/server.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_nova_server.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/nodes.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/89eb786478ea4c16114b1031bdf8c12844a46c2d', 'message': "Adopt node failure

1. 'preview' is not necessary for adopt in API level, if need, we
can set it node_adopt function in senlin-engin level.
2. disk_config of server may be None, but AUTO_DISJ_CONFIG is
boolean.
3. bdm of server may be None, but BLOCK_DEVICE_MAPPING is list.
4. config_drive of server may be empty string or None, but
CONFIG_DRIVE is boolean.

Change-Id: I76c0d689d7124f70af915f1e3c14c737314fd47f
Closes-Bug: #1705168
"}]
commit_message:
Adopt node failure

1. 'preview' is not necessary for adopt in API level, if need, we
can set it node_adopt function in senlin-engin level.
2. disk_config of server may be None, but AUTO_DISJ_CONFIG is
boolean.
3. bdm of server may be None, but BLOCK_DEVICE_MAPPING is list.
4. config_drive of server may be empty string or None, but
CONFIG_DRIVE is boolean.

Change-Id: I76c0d689d7124f70af915f1e3c14c737314fd47f
Closes-Bug: #1705168
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/92/485092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: drop non-neutron tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-16 13:17:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway/commit/1aa7aaefb98391256be068f6bcb16706b2f2ce19', 'message': 'do not check for nova-cert on newton and above

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/newton.html#deprecation-notes

"The /os-certificates API is deprecated, as well as the nova-cert
service which powers it."

e8f5341034c574aa07fb587e66c5c47a1d3620f8 blacklisted the package from
installation, however, the basic deployment test was not modified for
this charm which blocks CI for all changes.

Change-Id: Icf2ffd55d25e256ece35ef622d39112d27a25b61
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-17 14:58:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway/commit/b6697eef6d0f4507ef6e8a0fff568ac781f52925', 'message': 'drop non-neutron tests

In order to avoid blocking testing of the neutron charm due to
non-neutron related failures, let's delete them from this charm's tests.

---

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/newton.html#deprecation-notes

"The /os-certificates API is deprecated, as well as the nova-cert
service which powers it."

e8f5341034c574aa07fb587e66c5c47a1d3620f8 blacklisted the package from
installation, however, the basic deployment test was not modified for

commit_message:
drop non-neutron tests

In order to avoid blocking testing of the neutron charm due to
non-neutron related failures, let's delete them from this charm's tests.

---

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/newton.html#deprecation-notes

"The /os-certificates API is deprecated, as well as the nova-cert
service which powers it."

e8f5341034c574aa07fb587e66c5c47a1d3620f8 blacklisted the package from
installation, however, the basic deployment test was not modified for
this charm which blocks CI for all changes.

Change-Id: Icf2ffd55d25e256ece35ef622d39112d27a25b61

commit_message:
Add command to create policy from file

Add the following command for importing policy from file
`congress policy create-from-file <file path>`

Partially implements: blueprint policy-library
Partial-Bug: 1693622

Change-Id: Ic989a4d8319b04ccd5b52771ca6ae2190c9e15f5

revisions:

We never change the instance task_state during a swap
volume operation, so there is no reason to use the

Change-Id: I437ecb16682d69f83e6ec4fe0ca54fcc168ff448
'}]
commit_message:
Remove reverts_task_state decorator from swap_volume

We never change the instance task_state during a swap
volume operation, so there is no reason to use the
reverts_task_state decorator, as there is nothing to
revert back to in case of a failure.

Change-Id: I437ecb16682d69f83e6ec4fe0ca54fcc168ff448

cmd list.

commit_message:
Fix column names for server list --no-name-lookup

When --long is not present change the 'Image Name' column to
'Image' and add the 'Flavor' column.  These columns will contain
Names unless --no-name-lookup is specified when they will contain IDs.

Change-Id: I92cfb22136aee32616894e60e9227b4da185da99

commit_message:
Fix dynamic names in network functional tests

Move all of the dynamic resource naming in Network functional tests into
setUpClass() methods (if they exist) rather than assigning those names
at load-time.

Change-Id: Ic550ff7d40c2b3ca5128cacccbe331790d6ae340

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints.txt for tempest installation in venv

Currently, tempest plugins are installed via rpms and
are used(as --system-site-packages is used during virtualenv creation)
in tempest virtualenv.
Tempest installation is not currently constrained, this patch
makes it constrainted to upper-constraints.txt from [0] to avoid
dependency errors.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I85510dda99e600226f78f8cbc1361e099b68a7c9
(cherry picked from commit 883556f654b482a0ec11eb769a9a80f2503649e8)

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints.txt for tempest installation in venv

Currently, tempest plugins are installed via rpms and
are used(as --system-site-packages is used during virtualenv creation)
in tempest virtualenv.
Tempest installation is not currently constrained, this patch
makes it constrainted to upper-constraints.txt from [0] to avoid
dependency errors.

Change-Id: I85510dda99e600226f78f8cbc1361e099b68a7c9

This also adds a py35 job for heat-agents.

commit_message:
remove the very old unmaintained wsgi scripts

These are unmaintained, the correct way to do this is with the new pbr
entry points, which is what we test with in the gate. People get
confused and find these sometimes, so we should get rid of them to
avoid that.

Change-Id: Iaccec1d02d473972d243116e0b87c59faa92ea36

subject: Enable console during kernel boot on Power
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-07 17:55:57.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader', 'diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/cleanup.d/51-bootloader'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/bfdf7dc0f6b007d7e97dc99f33ed3f0725c376b4', 'message': "Enable console during kernel boot on Power

On Power systems console should be added the kernel command line
in the following order: 'console=tty0 console=hvc0'.
The first one is the graphical console. The last one is the serial
console. The kernel enables all the consoles pointed through the
kernel command line. However, only the last one will receive
input/output during kernel boot. All the other consoles will be
enabled after the boot.

Change-Id: I0069f608e0ab104d3778954e033fb82ed5ea7693
"}]
commit_message:
Enable console during kernel boot on Power

On Power systems console should be added the kernel command line
in the following order: 'console=tty0 console=hvc0'.
The first one is the graphical console. The last one is the serial
console. The kernel enables all the consoles pointed through the
kernel command line. However, only the last one will receive
input/output during kernel boot. All the other consoles will be
enabled after the boot.

Change-Id: I0069f608e0ab104d3778954e033fb82ed5ea7693
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/12/481712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
The correct option for label name in fat and vfat is '-n'

The code in mkfs correctly extends the command line with a '-n' for
vfat but does not currently do it for fat. This means that mkfs for
fat ends up with a '-L' which is what you'd do for everything like
ext[234].

The change just treats fat like vfat in the one place where this check
is required.

Change-Id: If65dfd949acdadff33a564640fb42ea73026a786
Closes-Bug: #1703063

In large environments amount of images can be very large (thousands)

This patch allows to avoid these queries by not doing translation,

commit_message:
Add server list -n and --no-name-lookup arguments

Remove translation of Image ID and Flavor ID to Image and Flavor names

In large environments amount of images can be very large (thousands)
Which requires ~hundreds of requests to Glance to get all images
(by default client request only 20 images)
As a result listing even few servers is going to take minutes

This patch allows to avoid these queries by not doing translation,
which allows one to get information about servers in seconds.

Change-Id: I4ae00e6324a41c4c79bf5b620179dae99aea5431

commit_message:
hacking: Use uuidutils or uuidsentinel to generate UUID

Added hacking check to ensure that UUID is being generated from
oslo_utils.uuidutils or uuidsentinel(in case of test cases)
instead of uuid4().

Depends-On: Ic50fc641eda532cad5f9a386eaef674ff7d6bbc9
Change-Id: I80745fefb30237e8fe7ff373e3d2fd3b55624b40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/80/397480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [N321] Use oslo_utils.uuidutils or uuidsentinel(in case of test cases) to generate UUID instead of uuid4().

commit_message:
Minor spelling fix

Breaking out as separate change so only doc jobs run
on the change.

Change-Id: I3760e5e973af3623e6b6fab5b6154400d3e082ec

subject: Count instances to check quota
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 11:12:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/46398415bf4f7f0a60d0e62e159bc653925a505f', 'message': 'WIP Count resources to check quota for cells

With cells v2, quota-related tables have moved to the API database.
Cells should be isolated from the API database and not be required to
read from it, but currently they must because of quota
reserve/commit/rollback within cells. To perform quota calculations
in the API, we will count resources to check quota instead of keeping
reservations and usages. Until nova-network is deprecated, cells will
still need to read limits from the API database when checking quota
for fixed_ips and floating_ips.

Implements blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602

'}, {'number': 24, 'created': '2017-04-19 03:56:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c1e140af47c3c100bcd54fdb86aecceb8267f62c', 'message': "Count instances to check quota

This changes instances, cores, and ram from ReservableResources to
CountableResources and replaces quota reserve/commit/rollback with
check_deltas accordingly.

A config option for 'max_pending_resizes' has been added to the 'quota'
group. When a user reverts a resize to a smaller flavor, there is a
possibility of exceeding cores and ram quota because quota is not
checked during a revert, so as not to block reverts.

All of the reservation and usage related unit tests are removed because
1) they rely on some global QuotaEngine resources being
ReservableResources and every ReservableResource has been removed and
2) reservations and usages are no longer in use anywhere in the
codebase.

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602

CountableResources and replaces quota reserve/commit/rollback with
check_deltas accordingly.

A config option for 'max_pending_resizes' has been added to the 'quota'
group. When a user reverts a resize to a smaller flavor, there is a
possibility of exceeding cores and ram quota because quota is not
checked during a revert, so as not to block reverts.

All of the reservation and usage related unit tests are removed because:

  1. They rely on some global QuotaEngine resources being
     ReservableResources and every ReservableResource has been removed.

  2. Reservations and usages are no longer in use anywhere in the
     codebase.

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602

commit_message:
Count instances to check quota

This changes instances, cores, and ram from ReservableResources to
CountableResources and replaces quota reserve/commit/rollback with
check_deltas accordingly.

All of the reservation and usage related unit tests are removed because:

  1. They rely on some global QuotaEngine resources being
     ReservableResources and every ReservableResource has been removed.
  2. Reservations and usages are no longer in use anywhere in the
     codebase.

Part of blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

Change-Id: I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602

commit_message:
Disable notifications

As part of the manila-telemetry integration work
we are now triggering notifications for several
events. We should provide a way to disable those.

In this patch-set we define a decorator that can be
used to change the behavior of those classes used
to emit notification.

Partially-Implements: bp ceilometer-integration

Change-Id: I806e0133e9fe3ad5cc35ad1e000e5ca61ff3b8ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/36/482136/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DoNothing(str): """Class that literrally does nothing. We inherit from str in case it's called with json.dumps. """ def __call__(self, *args, **kwargs): return self def __getattr__(self, name): return self DO_NOTHING = DoNothing() def notifications_enabled(conf): """Check if oslo notifications are enabled.""" notifications_driver = set(conf.oslo_messaging_notifications.driver) return notifications_driver and notifications_driver != {'noop'} def if_notifications_enabled(function): """Calls decorated method only if notifications are enabled.""" @functools.wraps(function) def wrapped(*args, **kwargs): if CONF.oslo_messaging_notifications.transport_url: return function(*args, **kwargs) return DO_NOTHING return wrapped

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-volumes instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-volumes related routes by a plain list,
instead of using stevedore.

After all the Nova API endpoints moves to the plain routes list,
the usage of stevedore for API loading will be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Ie76ef6c78cf1d97629cdfa3ffc314a21cd4ddb69

commit_message:
Add -m flag to setfiles for Fedora 26

As described in the comment and associated bugzilla, the behaviour of
setfiles has changed in Fedora 26 to require "-m" situations where
labeled file-systems are mounted below non-labeled file-systems.  Our
loopback/chroot system appears to trigger this nicely, leading to a
setfiles call that does nothing without this.

Change-Id: I276c6f6a4fb44f4bea5004f6b4214f94757728ae
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/99/485099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # setfiles in > Fedora 26 added this flag: # do not read /proc/mounts to obtain a list of # non-seclabel mounts to be excluded from relabeling # checks. Setting this option is useful where there is # a non-seclabel fs mounted with a seclabel fs # this describes our situation of being on a loopback device on # an ubuntu system, say. See also # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1472709 _dash_m = "" if [[ $DISTRO_NAME == "fedora" && $DIB_RELEASE -ge 26 ]]; then _dash_m = "-m" fi $SETFILES ${_dash_m} /etc/selinux/targeted/contexts/files/file_contexts ${MOUNTPOINT}

commit_message:
yum-minimal: pre-install coreutils

As described in the referenced bug, the dependency solver in yum
doesn't handle weak dependencies well and in some cases, such as
Fedora 26, can end up choosing coreutils-single (the busybox-esque
single binary) instead of actual coreutils, which then causes problems
with conflicting packages later.

Change-Id: I2907bf3b74c146986b483d52cc6ac437036330b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/24/484624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local _lang_pack="" local _extra_pkgs="" # Yum has some issues choosing weak dependencies. It can end # up choosing "coreutils-single" instead of "coreutils" which # causes problems later when a package actually requires # coreutils. For more info see # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1286445 # Really all we can do is pre-install the right thing _extra_pkgs+="coreutils " install $@ ${_lang_pack} ${_extra_pkgs} && rc=$? || rc=$?

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-18 04:55:16.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/pip-and-virtualenv/install.d/pip-and-virtualenv-source-install/04-install-pip'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/b8ad9c2e37ca7a1597cac048795c9369dd1e22d8', 'message': "Force install during pip-and-virtualenv

On a system where the packaged pip/virtualenv is up-to-date with
upstream (such as Fedora 26 ... for now), we don't reinstall, which
then violates a bunch of assumptions later on.  Force install.

Change-Id: I6ebcda0351997fa7e32f0e6e77a98b2c33764e3f
"}]
commit_message:
Force install during pip-and-virtualenv

On a system where the packaged pip/virtualenv is up-to-date with
upstream (such as Fedora 26 ... for now), we don't reinstall, which
then violates a bunch of assumptions later on.  Force install.

Change-Id: I6ebcda0351997fa7e32f0e6e77a98b2c33764e3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/23/484623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # force things to happen so our assumptions hold pip_args="-U --force-reinstall" python /tmp/get-pip.py ${pip_args} pip install ${pip_args} setuptools python3 /tmp/get-pip.py ${pip_args} pip3 install ${pip_args} setuptools pip3 install ${pip_args} virtualenv pip install ${pip_args} virtualenv
deleted_lines: python /tmp/get-pip.py pip install -U setuptools python3 /tmp/get-pip.py pip3 install -U setuptools pip3 install -U virtualenv pip install -U virtualenv

subject: Fix latest-limit command line
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-18 03:17:44.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/redhat-common/finalise.d/01-clean-old-kernels'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/da90ef47433bbcfa31fa16740e9d60657ba03960', 'message': 'Fix latest-limit command line

It turns out dnf argparse can't handle negative numbers without "=".
It's actually documented in the man page

    --latest-limit <number> ...  If <number> is negative skip <number>
      of latest packages. If a negative number is used use syntax
      --latest-limit=<number>

But who reads that :)  This started failing with Fedora 26

Change-Id: I884af94c07fa11b010f69863047a04711b14f21e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix latest-limit command line

It turns out dnf argparse can't handle negative numbers without "=".
It's actually documented in the man page

    --latest-limit <number> ...  If <number> is negative skip <number>
      of latest packages. If a negative number is used use syntax
      --latest-limit=<number>

But who reads that :)  This started failing with Fedora 26

Change-Id: I884af94c07fa11b010f69863047a04711b14f21e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/10/484610/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

change get_target_version() to class method

to be a class method.

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

commit_message:
Handle readfp deprecation for freezer

In py3.4 notice method readfp will removed in the future,
so use method readfile to replace it.This warning is only
in py3 and above.Py2,configparse do not have.Actually in py3,
This function is finally pointed to the readfile function

warnings.warn( "This method will be removed in future versions. "
              "Use 'parser.read_file()' instead.",
			  DeprecationWarning, stacklevel=2 )
self.read_file(fp, source=filename)

Change-Id: I6fd7fed3f2e3236eaaeefadcc88e929d86fa192f

commit_message:
Handle readfp deprecation for swift

In py3.4 notice method readfp will removed in the future,
so use method readfile to replace it.This warning is only
in py3 and above.Py2,configparse do not have.Actually in py3,
This function is finally pointed to the readfile function

warnings.warn( "This method will be removed in future versions. "
              "Use 'parser.read_file()' instead.",
			  DeprecationWarning, stacklevel=2 )
self.read_file(fp, source=filename)

Change-Id: I17d2f31a04b00eecf12fa7ed7badb9c1c395a11f

commit_message:
Handle readfp deprecation for charm-ceilometer-agent

In py3.4 notice method readfp will removed in the future,
so use method readfile to replace it.This warning is only
in py3 and above.Py2,configparse do not have.Actually in py3,
This function is finally pointed to the readfile function

warnings.warn( "This method will be removed in future versions. "
              "Use 'parser.read_file()' instead.",
			  DeprecationWarning, stacklevel=2 )
self.read_file(fp, source=filename)

Change-Id: If501bb49d9b12dc40d53c0c3f617fe9018bf26ae

commit_message:
use six.StringIO for compatibility with io.StringIO in python3

The newer version of six (1.4.1) provides six.StringIO
which is a fake file object for textual data. It's an
alias for cStringIO.StringIO, in python2 and io.StringIO
in Python3.

Change-Id: I79a620fc547b278e1d3a089e6f37e98992abd86a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/70/412670/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items() for cue

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ica0fc325f22c2cfdd9b069fe3fad6983b34443c2

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception for designate

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ic7019941292af1045f40eb1fd56f6240088aa0ba

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) with optimal assert for ironic

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) .
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I12aae10e777ffe8f191c27dd199dcc2535f97762

commit_message:
Support underscore headers in ingress

Nginx's configuration has the underscore header value disabled.
When uploading image, glance api uses underscore header.
For example, x-image-meta-disk_format or x-image-meta_name.

Change-Id: I86e7f7d8d908904a4e45fa68f6bd613028d45801
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/19/485219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apiVersion: v1 kind: ConfigMap metadata: name: nginx-custom-configuration data: enable-underscores-in-headers: "true"

commit_message:
Handle uuids in os-hypervisors API

There are quite a few changes here as this is not only handling
uuids for the hypervisor id but it's also a refactor in several
APIs for consistency.

The main changes are detailed in the REST API Version History
doc in this change, but to summarize the changes:

* Hypervisor and service IDs are handled as the UUIDs for those
  resources; this is necessary for accurately working with these
  resources across multiple cells.
* The 'servers' and 'search' routes are deprecated and folded into
  the index and detail methods as query parameters, validated using
  json schema.
* The show method will also be able to return the list of servers
  hosted on the given hypervisor using the with_servers query
  parameter.
* The marker used when paging over lists of hypervisors is the
  compute node UUID.
* Using the hypervisor_hostname_pattern query parameter will not
  work with paging parameters.
* API reference docs are updated for the detailed changes.
* Functional and unit tests are provided for all changes.

Part of blueprint service-hyper-uuid-in-api

Change-Id: I828350c179df8bcfa4739910abeafaba2f96982b

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2017-06-13 17:56:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9583e24deda2b2e7f7148e48f1f224db620a24e5', 'message': "Use uuid for id in os-services API

This patch introduces API version 2.49 to identify services by uuid
instead of id, to ensure uniqueness across cells. GET /os-services
returns uuid in the id field, and uuid must be provided to delete a
service with DELETE /os-services/{service_uuid}.

The old PUT /os-services/* APIs are now capped at 2.48 and replaced
with a new PUT /os-services/{service_uuid} which takes a uuid path
parameter to uniquely identify the service to update. It also restricts
updates to nova-compute services only, since disabling or forcing-down
a non-compute service like nova-scheduler doesn't make sense as it
doesn't do anything.

The new update() method for 2.49 also avoids trying to re-use the
existing private action methods like _enable and _disable since those
are predicated on looking up the service by host/binary, are confusing
to follow for code flow, and just don't really make sense with a pure
PUT resource update method.

Part of blueprint service-hyper-uuid-in-api

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I45494a4df7ee4454edb3ef8e7c5817d8c4e9e5ad

commit_message:
Use uuid for id in os-services API

This patch introduces a new microversion to identify services by uuid
instead of id, to ensure uniqueness across cells. GET /os-services
returns uuid in the id field, and uuid must be provided to delete a
service with DELETE /os-services/{service_uuid}.

The old PUT /os-services/* APIs are now capped and replaced
with a new PUT /os-services/{service_uuid} which takes a uuid path
parameter to uniquely identify the service to update. It also restricts
updates to nova-compute services only, since disabling or forcing-down
a non-compute service like nova-scheduler doesn't make sense as it
doesn't do anything.

The new update() method in this microversion also avoids trying to
re-use the existing private action methods like _enable and _disable
since those are predicated on looking up the service by host/binary,
are confusing to follow for code flow, and just don't really make sense
with a pure PUT resource update method.

Part of blueprint service-hyper-uuid-in-api

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I45494a4df7ee4454edb3ef8e7c5817d8c4e9e5ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/464280/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import uuidutilsUUID_FOR_ID_MIN_VERSION = '2.46' def _get_service_detail(self, svc, additional_fields, req=None): uuid_for_id = req and api_version_request.is_supported( req, min_version=UUID_FOR_ID_MIN_VERSION) 'id': svc['uuid' if uuid_for_id else 'id'], return [self._get_service_detail(svc, additional_fields, req=req) if api_version_request.is_supported( req, min_version=UUID_FOR_ID_MIN_VERSION): if not uuidutils.is_uuid_like(id): msg = _('Invalid uuid %s') % id raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) else: try: utils.validate_integer(id, 'id') except exception.InvalidInput as exc: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest( explanation=exc.format_message())
deleted_lines: def _get_service_detail(self, svc, additional_fields): 'id': svc['id'], return [self._get_service_detail(svc, additional_fields) try: utils.validate_integer(id, 'id') except exception.InvalidInput as exc: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=exc.format_message())

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix an expand button in os-quota-sets

If section reference name is changed not to overlap,
when the 'List Default Quotas For Tenant' API section
is collapsed, it cannot be followed by users.
So the reference is changed to the 'os-quota-sets' chapter.

Change-Id: Ic61b38cabde3b3225f778833f0e7aae6acf5eabc
Closes-Bug: #1705191

added_lines: "List Default Quotas For Tenant" API in :ref:`os-quota-sets` but that is per project quota.
deleted_lines: :ref:`list-default-quotas-for-tenant` API but that is per project quota.

subject: bump neutron-lib to 1.9.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-19 14:42:27.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/333ec330f0a80fdac5dc0532a261e83107b90515', 'message': 'bump neutron-lib to 1.9.0

The upper constrains for neutron-lib have already been bumped for 1.9.0
in I2022427c1705fa12a642c3a018cfd3dfdd7f38b1, but we'd like to see the
requirement change propagated into all consumers so that we can begin
using the changes in neutron-lib between 1.7.0 and 1.9.0. This patch
bumps neutron-lib to 1.9.0 so consuming requirements.txt will be updated
allowing us to use the latest release in neutron and other networking
projects. For a list of features see the "highlights" in
be35a3b810118ad043ad3056d00186fa7ff655df and
e8f155142dd80c2013f0d3357f77e7beca8c69b4.

Change-Id: I29c8413d69ca801cd2375458759a9c19cd70cde5
'}]
commit_message:
bump neutron-lib to 1.9.0

The upper constrains for neutron-lib have already been bumped for 1.9.0
in I2022427c1705fa12a642c3a018cfd3dfdd7f38b1, but we'd like to see the
requirement change propagated into all consumers so that we can begin
using the changes in neutron-lib between 1.7.0 and 1.9.0. This patch
bumps neutron-lib to 1.9.0 so consuming requirements.txt will be updated
allowing us to use the latest release in neutron and other networking
projects. For a list of features see the "highlights" in
be35a3b810118ad043ad3056d00186fa7ff655df and
e8f155142dd80c2013f0d3357f77e7beca8c69b4.

Change-Id: I29c8413d69ca801cd2375458759a9c19cd70cde5

commit_message:
improve the documentation for log format strings

Incorporate some of the information from the upstream docs here and add
information about a few of our custom message parameters.

Change-Id: Ib6f934e7f5d6e43afa8021241f92000c644c5e6d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/26/459426/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We don't want to hard-code the line number where the message # will be produced, so look for the parts around that. expected_pattern = ("CRITICAL somename:\d+ \[-\] " "Exception: Some error happened") self.assertRegexpMatches( self.stream.getvalue(), expected_pattern, )
deleted_lines: expected_string = ("CRITICAL somename [-] " "Exception: Some error happened") self.assertIn(expected_string, self.stream.getvalue(), message="Exception is not logged")

subject: Ensure ordering of cluster hosts is consistent for same data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-18 14:50:31.000000000', 'files': ['charms_openstack/charm/classes.py', 'charms_openstack/adapters.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack/commit/03ba9967c393a92b4e6721012097f596a5010a70', 'message': "Ensure ordering of cluster hosts is consistent for same data

Python dictionaries don't have the order of their keys guaranteed, and
so when they are used to write config files, the order of the entries
may change. This can cause a restart of a dependent service.  Due to the
way that reactive invokes all 'true condition' handlers for every hook
invocation, this means that services might restart for every single hook
including 'update-status'.

This patch attempts to address that issue.

Related Bug: #1698814

Change-Id: Ic6c1d3d103a25b15ea202638c21213aea11cd3da
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure ordering of cluster hosts is consistent for same data

Python dictionaries don't have the order of their keys guaranteed, and
so when they are used to write config files, the order of the entries
may change. This can cause a restart of a dependent service.  Due to the
way that reactive invokes all 'true condition' handlers for every hook
invocation, this means that services might restart for every single hook
including 'update-status'.

This patch attempts to address that issue.

Related Bug: #1698814

Change-Id: Ic6c1d3d103a25b15ea202638c21213aea11cd3da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack refs/changes/35/484835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collections # Note(AJK) - bug #1698814 - cluster_hosts needs to be ordered so that # re-writes with no changed data don't cause a restart (dictionaries # are 'randomly' ordered) self.cluster_hosts = collections.OrderedDict() 'backends': collections.OrderedDict( [(self.local_unit_name, laddr)])} 'backends': collections.OrderedDict( [(self.local_unit_name, self.local_address)])}} # Note(AJK) - ensure that service ports is always in the same order service_ports = collections.OrderedDict() if self.port_map: for service in sorted(self.port_map.keys()):
deleted_lines: self.cluster_hosts = {} 'backends': {self.local_unit_name: laddr}} 'backends': {self.local_unit_name: self.local_address}}} service_ports = {} if self.port_map: for service in self.port_map.keys():

commit_message:
Remove leading openstack/ from project name

The leading openstack/ is repetitive. There are zero chances anything
will make it into this file without a leading openstack/.

We're not actually using project for anything yet, but we want to use
it for both validation of documentation locations as well as being able
to send legacy-style microversion headers. Rather than removing the
openstack/ at processing time, remove it in the data.

Change-Id: I740af4211dcf142865f1fe70fec41ab5ae73d0e3

commit_message:
Minimise distro packages installed

The current package install set is quite broad
for xenial. This reduces the set and ensures that
the pip packages installed are appropriate based
on the python version used for each distro.

ndg-httpsclient specifically is only required
for python<2.7.9

Conflicts:
>------vars/suse-42.yml

Change-Id: I65d05f6fd187b896e5e710f9d95f89bf769ecc60
(cherry picked from commit dfb91fbaec8a2c512777ccc4ded817e952e22b39)

commit_message:
Fix charm error when domain-backend relation disconnects

The charm failed with an error so that it wasn't properly removed.
This fix allows the domain-backend disconnect event to be handled so
that the charm can be removed.

Change-Id: I850eadb48af8709e25cb9203ddf9a135f1d94c8f

commit_message:
Implement fetching and accessor methods

The ServiceTypes class is the main entry point for python programmers.
It should allow them to answer the questions they have about the data
without necessarily walking the structure. It can also return the raw
structure if people want to get at it.

We need to know the project codename for services for doing API doc
publication validation and also for being able to send legacy
microversion headers. The information is in the data, use it.

In order to construct and send microversion headers for projects with
aliases, we need to know ALL of the aliases plus the official name,
because we don't know which one of the values will be the correct name
the service is looking for for a given version. The microversion spec,
however, requires that consumers be able to handle a header that
contains a list of services and to ignore the ones it isn't looking for.

By providing a a list of all the possible values we make it easy to
construct a header for a service given a service_type that should work
for all known identifiers of the service and that is future compatible
with the service-type and microversion specifyier aligning.

Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Change-Id: I57641c9e3c27688b6d7709b1bb07292740d26659

commit_message:
Minimise distro packages installed

The current package install set is quite broad
for Ubuntu. This reduces the set and ensures that
the pip packages installed are appropriate.

Backport note:
This is a re-implementation of the master patch
due to differences in the content.

Change-Id: I65d05f6fd187b896e5e710f9d95f89bf769ecc60

commit_message:
Make keystone v3 endpoints the default

The logic which previously implemented a
check for v3 in the endpoint does not work
with versionless endpoints.

As versionless endpoints are likely to be
more common, and the v3 auth protocol is
now the defult and the norm, the check is
now done for a v2 endpoint instead.

Related-Bug: #1688320
Change-Id: If4818e6220aba921890e647cfb21e078bb254821

commit_message:
IBM Storage - Fix vol create from snapshot in CG

running vol create from snapshot ID of vol that belongs to CG fails.
The reason for this is the naming convention inside the storage
which is different for regular volume snapshots and snapshots of
volumes that result from cgsnapshot.

Change-Id: Ibdfc0e09518f38e137b31faf5a386be3938af7d6
Closes-Bug: 1699056

commit_message:
Add Kubernetes API Service IP to x509 certificates

By default, API service with service account is accessible from inside
the cluster at the address 10.254.0.1. This IP should be added to SANS
when generating the certs.

Fixes-bug: #1660811
Change-Id: I214b4296bea55bb0c4015165c56fbd8ca3cebd39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/37/436037/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 21:21:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/75799848ed6e5c8a8864c6aa4afcdc9eb90474e2', 'message': 'create network metadata information as static even with dhcp

This allows the operator to choose to have network metadata always
act as if the network configuration should be static.  Even when
dhcp is enabled on the network in neutron.

Change-Id: I7faaec76003a300b3e0f8a6541feb087261bef33
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-30 22:27:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/052253e09de43eadfad970e578cec82024ce46f4', 'message': 'Option to always create network metadata information as static

This allows the operator to choose to have network metadata always
act as if the network configuration should be static.  Even when
dhcp is enabled on the network in neutron.

This is useful because:
- If an image is missing cloud-init or it fails to run, I
  as an operator want the image to be able to dhcp as last resort.
  - IE I want everything static - as the prefered, but have
    dhcp enabled as a backup
- Some images that people use come with eth0 by default configured
  to dhcp (so this fallback works nicely if dhcp is really still
  needed)
- Plus with ironic, I need dhcp enabled so that boxes will dhcp
  during pxe boot but afterwards - I dont want them to be tied to
  a dhcp server.

Change-Id: I7faaec76003a300b3e0f8a6541feb087261bef33

  needed)
- Plus with ironic, I need dhcp enabled so that boxes will dhcp
  during pxe boot but afterwards - I dont want them to be tied to
  a dhcp server.

commit_message:
Option to always create network metadata information as static

This allows the operator to choose to have network metadata always
act as if the network configuration should be static.  Even when
dhcp is enabled on the network in neutron.

This is useful because:
- If an image is missing cloud-init or it fails to run, I
  as an operator want the image to be able to dhcp as last resort.
  - IE I want everything static - as the prefered, but have
    dhcp enabled as a backup
- Some images that people use come with eth0 by default configured
  to dhcp (so this fallback works nicely if dhcp is really still
  needed)
- Plus with ironic, I need dhcp enabled so that boxes will dhcp
  during pxe boot but afterwards - I dont want them to be tied to
  a dhcp server.

Implements: blueprint conf-network-metadata-always-static-ip
Partial-Bug: 1676363
Change-Id: I7faaec76003a300b3e0f8a6541feb087261bef33

patch to validate service-types for api ref will always make remote

commit_message:
Remove the local cache implementation

The first immediate consumers don't need the caching. The project-config
patch to validate service-types for api ref will always make remote
calls. The initial KSA patch does not pass a session and so never makes
calls.

Go ahead and just give up on the local cache implementation. We can add
cachecontrol when we get the unit testing worked out - but adding it
shouldn't actually change the interface, since it's a transparent cache.

Change-Id: Ib7ab272005cadfa0e82a1b99214b5468c113b6f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-service-types refs/changes/26/485026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2017 Red Hat, Inc # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import json import os import sys import tempfile import threading import time # Not using six.moves to keep dependencies to a minimum if sys.version_info.major == 2: import urlparse else: import urllib.parse as urlparse import os_service_types.data # TODO(mordred) Use CacheControl headers instead of hardcoding this # once they are being sent. # seconds * mintues * hours * days == one week in seconds CACHE_AGE = 60*60*24*7 # TODO(mordred) This needs a Windows friendly solution that doesn't involve # adding an appdirs dependency. CACHE_ROOT = '~/.cache' _cache_data_managers = {} _cache_lock = threading.Lock() def get_cache_data_manager(url, *args, **kwargs): """Get the CacheDataManager object for the given url. :param str url: URL of the remote object. The remote object should contain JSON data and send ETag headers. Takes the same parameters as the CacheDataManager constructor. """ if url not in _cache_data_managers: if _cache_lock.acquire(True): try: _cache_data_managers[url] = _get_cache_data_manager( url, *args, **kwargs) finally: _cache_lock.release() return _cache_data_managers[url] def _get_cache_data_manager(url, *args, **kwargs): # Did we block waiting for the lock because someone else did the # update? if url in _cache_data_managers: return _cache_data_managers[url] return CacheDataManager(url, *args, **kwargs) class CacheWrapper(dict): """Private class wrapping remote data and etag.""" def __init__(self, data, etag=None): super(CacheWrapper, self).__init__() self['data'] = data self['etag'] = etag @property def etag(self): return self['etag'] @etag.setter def etag(self, value): self['etag'] = value @property def data(self): return self['data'] @data.setter def data(self, value): self['data'] = value class CacheDataManager(object): """Private class encapsulating fetching and cache management. The data comes from the following places in order of best to worst. * If force_remote is True, fetch and return remote data, failing if it can't be fetched. * If cached data exists: * If no Session is given, return cached data. * If the user cannot write to the cached data, treat cache as authoritative and return cached data. * If the cache file has a modification time less than one week old, return cached data. * If the cache file has a modication time more than one week old, do a GET with If-None-Match set to the previous ETag. If new data is returned, return it. * Return cached data. * If a Session has been given, fetch and return remote data. * Return builtin data. NOTE: The python CacheControl library can also do this more generally. However, it's more complex and would add a dependency. Since this library will be in the critical path for every OpenStack REST interaction, dependencies need to be taken very seriously. For these purposes, since we have essentially one thing we're caching and rigid definitions of how it works, we're implementing it locally. Every time someone has the urge to add functionality to this class, it should first be considered whether or not migrating to CacheControl would be a better idea. :param str url: URL of the remote object. The remote object should contain json data. :param session: An object that behaves like a `requests.Session` or a `keystoneauth1.session.Session` that provides a get method and returns an object that behaves like a `requests.Response`. If one is not passed, no remote actions will be performed. :param bool force_remote: Whether to force a remote data fetch. If True, failed attempts to fetch data will be treated as fatal. Optional, defaults to False. :param str name: Name of the cache. Optional, defaults to 'openstack'. :param str cache_root: Base directory to store cached data in. Will have name appended to it. Defaults to '~/.cache'. :returns: A dictionary containing the remote data content. :rtype: dict """ def __init__( self, url, session=None, force_remote=False, name='openstack', cache_root=CACHE_ROOT): self.url = url self.session = session self.force_remote = force_remote self._cache_root = os.path.expanduser(cache_root) self._cache_dir = os.path.join(self._cache_root, name) self._cache_file_name = urlparse.urlparse(self.url).path.split('/')[-1] self._cache_file = os.path.join(self._cache_dir, self._cache_file_name) self._can_write = None self._data = None @property def can_write_to_cache(self): if self._can_write is None: self._can_write = check_write_cache(self._cache_dir) return self._can_write @property def data(self): if not self._data: self._data = self._build_data() return self._data.data def _build_data(self): if self.force_remote: return self.fetch_and_cache() data = self.get_cached_data() if self.should_fetch(data): data = self.fetch_and_cache(cached_data=data) if not data: data = self.get_builtin_data() return data def get_cached_data(self): """Read the data from the cache file if it exists.""" if os.path.exists(self._cache_file): return CacheWrapper(**self.read_json_file(self._cache_file)) return None def should_fetch(self, data): """Determine whether or not remote data should be fetched. If there is no session but there is a cached data, we want to use the cached cached. If force_remote is true, we always want to fetch remote data. If there is no cache file, we want to try to fetch remote data. If the file is older than a week, we at least want to try to fetch newer data if it is available. :param CacheData data: Existing cached data. :returns: true if a new file needs to be fetched :rtype: boolean """ if self.session is None: # If we don't have a session, we should not fetch things. return False if self.force_remote: # The user has requested an explicit remote fetch. # Ignore file age or existence of the file. return True if data and not self.can_write_to_cache: # If cache data exists and we can't update the cache, assume # the cache data is authoritative. return False if not data: # If the cache file doesn't exist, we should fetch the data, # regardless of whether we can write it to cache or not. return True # If the file exists and is old, check for new data. return (time.time() - os.path.getmtime(self._cache_file)) > CACHE_AGE def touch_cache_file(self): """Update time on cache file to reset staleness check.""" if not self.can_write_to_cache: return os.utime(self._cache_file, None) def get_builtin_data(self): """Return data that is shipped inside the python package.""" local_file = os.path.join( os.path.dirname(os_service_types.data.__file__), self._cache_file_name) return CacheWrapper(data=self.read_json_file(local_file)) def read_json_file(self, filename): return json.load(open(filename, 'r')) def write_cache_file(self, data): if not self.can_write_to_cache: return ensure_cache_dir(self._cache_dir) # Write to a different file, then rename for lockless atomic semantics temp_out = tempfile.mktemp(suffix=data['etag'], dir=self._cache_dir) json.dump(data, open(temp_out, 'w'), indent=2) os.rename(temp_out, self._cache_file) def fetch_and_cache(self, cached_data=None): headers = {} if cached_data and cached_data.etag: headers['If-None-Match'] = cached_data.etag try: response = self.session.get(self.url, headers=headers) response.raise_for_status() except IOError: # We trap for IOError as it's the base class of all requests # exceptions and we don't have requests actually imported. if not self.force_remote: return cached_data # If self.force_remote, all network errors are fatal raise # There are only two valid status codes if response.status_code == 200: data = CacheWrapper( etag=response.headers['etag'], data=response.json()) self.write_cache_file(data) return data elif response.status_code == 304: # Reset the staleness clock since a remote operation was performed self.touch_cache_file() return cached_data return None def check_write_cache(cache_dir): """Do we have the ability to write cache files. :returns: true if a new file needs to be fetched :rtype: boolean """ while True: if os.access(cache_dir, os.W_OK): # If we can write to it, all is good, we can write cache files return True elif (os.path.exists(cache_dir) and not os.access(cache_dir, os.W_OK)): # If it exists and we can't write to it, we can't write. return False # It doens't exist, try up a level to see if we can create it new_cache_dir = os.path.dirname(cache_dir) if new_cache_dir == cache_dir: # We've walked all the way up to root, good for us, game over. return False cache_dir = new_cache_dir def ensure_cache_dir(cache_dir): if os.access(cache_dir, os.W_OK): return True parent_dir = os.path.dirname(cache_dir) if parent_dir == cache_dir: # We're at the root and we still can't write to anything return False if not ensure_cache_dir(parent_dir): return False os.makedirs(cache_dir) return True

subject: Add support for getting a complete list of type names
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-17 20:02:27.000000000', 'files': ['os_service_types/service_types.py', 'os_service_types/tests/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-service-types/commit/0271331e5abfd6aa7149125569c3a82af9bd57a3', 'message': "Add support for getting a complete list of type names

In order to construct and send microversion headers for projects with
aliases, we need to know ALL of the aliases plus the official name,
because we don't know which one of the values will be the correct name
the service is looking for for a given version. The microversion spec,
however, requires that consumers be able to handle a header that
contains a list of services and to ignore the ones it isn't looking for.

By providing a a list of all the possible values we make it easy to
construct a header for a service given a service_type that should work
for all known identifiers of the service and that is future compatible
with the service-type and microversion specifyier aligning.

Change-Id: I2231c32078533b2ea2a348e67f5c72e5cff5e6b5
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for getting a complete list of type names

In order to construct and send microversion headers for projects with
aliases, we need to know ALL of the aliases plus the official name,
because we don't know which one of the values will be the correct name
the service is looking for for a given version. The microversion spec,
however, requires that consumers be able to handle a header that
contains a list of services and to ignore the ones it isn't looking for.

By providing a a list of all the possible values we make it easy to
construct a header for a service given a service_type that should work
for all known identifiers of the service and that is future compatible
with the service-type and microversion specifyier aligning.

Change-Id: I2231c32078533b2ea2a348e67f5c72e5cff5e6b5

commit_message:
Refactor bulk of data checking into mixin class

We have a set of testscenarios that match with test methods that
validate input and output data. We also have a test class which
describes each type of setup. Copy the scenarios and methods into a
mixin class so that we can have one rather than two sets of those.

Change-Id: I7c96e89d9c5a5d8336abcb63de8aac0d17b4b3f6

deleted_lines: class TestBuiltin(base.TestCase): scenarios = [ ('compute', dict( service_type='compute', official='compute', aliases=[], is_known=True, is_alias=False, is_official=True, project='nova')), ('volumev2', dict( service_type='volumev2', official='block-storage', aliases=[], is_known=True, is_alias=True, is_official=False, project='cinder')), ('volumev3', dict( service_type='volumev3', official='block-storage', aliases=[], is_known=True, is_alias=True, is_official=False, project='cinder')), ('block-storage', dict( service_type='block-storage', official='block-storage', aliases=['volume', 'volumev2', 'volumev3'], is_known=True, is_alias=False, is_official=True, project='cinder')), ('missing', dict( service_type='missing', official=None, aliases=[], is_known=False, is_alias=False, is_official=False, project=None)), ] def test_get_service_type(self): if self.official: self.assertEqual( self.official, self.service_types.get_service_type(self.service_type)) else: self.assertIsNone( self.service_types.get_service_type(self.service_type)) def test_get_aliases(self): self.assertEqual( self.aliases, self.service_types.get_aliases(self.service_type)) def test_is_known(self): self.assertEqual( self.is_known, self.service_types.is_known(self.service_type)) def test_is_alias(self): self.assertEqual( self.is_alias, self.service_types.is_alias(self.service_type)) def test_is_official(self): self.assertEqual( self.is_official, self.service_types.is_official(self.service_type)) def test_get_project_name(self): if self.project: self.assertEqual( self.project, self.service_types.get_project_name(self.service_type)) else: self.assertIsNone( self.service_types.get_project_name(self.service_type)) def test_get_service_data(self): service_data = self.service_types.get_service_data(self.service_type) service_type = self.service_types.get_service_type(self.service_type) api_url = 'http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/{service_type}/' # Tests self.official here, since we expect to get data back for all # official projects, regardless of service_type being an alias or not if not self.official: self.assertIsNone(service_data) else: self.assertIsNotNone(service_data) self.assertEqual( 'openstack/{project}'.format(project=self.project), service_data['project']) self.assertEqual(self.official, service_data['service_type']) self.assertEqual( api_url.format(service_type=service_type), service_data['api_reference']) def test_get_official_service_data(self): service_data = self.service_types.get_official_service_data( self.service_type) service_type = self.service_types.get_service_type(self.service_type) api_url = 'http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/{service_type}/' # Tests self.is_official here, since we expect only get data back for # official projects. if not self.is_official: self.assertIsNone(service_data) else: self.assertIsNotNone(service_data) self.assertEqual( 'openstack/{project}'.format(project=self.project), service_data['project']) self.assertEqual(self.official, service_data['service_type']) self.assertEqual( api_url.format(service_type=service_type), service_data['api_reference']) def test_empty_project_error(self): if not self.project: self.assertRaises( ValueError, self.service_types.get_service_data_for_project, self.project) def test_get_service_data_for_project(self): if not self.project: self.skipTest("Empty project is invalid but tested elsewhere.") return service_data = self.service_types.get_service_data_for_project( self.project) service_type = self.service_types.get_service_type(self.service_type) api_url = 'http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/{service_type}/' self.assertIsNotNone(service_data) self.assertEqual( 'openstack/{project}'.format(project=self.project), service_data['project']) self.assertEqual(self.official, service_data['service_type']) self.assertEqual( api_url.format(service_type=service_type), service_data['api_reference'])

subject: Add support for getting OpenStack project information
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-17 17:34:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-service-types/commit/daeb3c366270c3cc327b964dc7c9fe7542e079af', 'message': 'Add support for getting OpenStack project information

We need to know the project codename for services for doing API doc
publication validation and also for being able to send legacy

commit_message:
Add support for getting OpenStack project information

We need to know the project codename for services for doing API doc
publication validation and also for being able to send legacy
microversion headers. The information is in the data, use it.

Handle both leading openstack/ and no leading openstack/

Change-Id: I71d2c4c0d3ca3ff8f821e4106424d3af4a05f245
Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
ScaleIO Driver: Updating config reference

Pike introduced a simpler means of configuring the ScaleIo driver.
Update the config reference with the necessary information.
Updating the config options tables as the process to auto-
generate them is not working properly.

Change-Id: If5a09c31cd2f7808bd73e4426005f8fb5f404653
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/53/484453/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ScaleIO Gateway server IPThe ScaleIO Gateway provides a REST interface to ScaleIO. Configure the Gateway server IP address by adding the following parameter:the virtual machines. The list should include every Protection Domain and Storage Pool pair that you would like Cinder to utilize.
deleted_lines: ScaleIO MDM server IPThe ScaleIO Meta Data Manager monitors and maintains the available resources and permissions. To retrieve the MDM server IP address, use the :command:`drv_cfg --query_mdms` command. Configure the MDM server IP address by adding the following parameter:ScaleIO Protection Domain name ------------------------------ ScaleIO allows multiple Protection Domains (groups of SDSs that provide backup for each other). To retrieve the available Protection Domains, use the command :command:`scli --query_all` and search for the Protection Domains section. Configure the Protection Domain for newly created volumes by adding the following parameter: .. code-block:: ini sio_protection_domain_name = ScaleIO Protection Domain ScaleIO Storage Pool name ------------------------- A ScaleIO Storage Pool is a set of physical devices in a Protection Domain. To retrieve the available Storage Pools, use the command :command:`scli --query_all` and search for available Storage Pools. Configure the Storage Pool for newly created volumes by adding the following parameter: .. code-block:: ini sio_storage_pool_name = ScaleIO Storage Poolthe virtual machines. sio_protection_domain_name = Default_domain sio_storage_pool_name = Default_pool

commit_message:
Fix incorrect docstrings in neutron network API

_validate_requested_network_ids uses the requested_networks list
that was updated by _validate_requested_port_ids to contain
network_id, not request_id, for all port requests.

_update_ports_for_instance updates the ports, not creates them.

Change-Id: Iefca0088293b500c5c86cec2029d1add58bbf868

commit_message:
Expose ports' physical network attribute in API

In change Ib22753aa6ae0fedce7fb9ecf63f135fda0185c5b the port data model
was updated to include a physical_network field, but this was not
exposed to the user by the REST API. This change exposes the
physical_network field in the REST API.

The port CRUD notification object has been updated to include the
physical_network field.

The API reference and user guide have been updated to include
information about the ports' physical network field.

The API microversion has been bumped to 1.34. During a rolling upgrade
from Ocata when the API service is pinned, the port physical network
field is hidden from API responses, and API requests including the field
are rejected.

Change-Id: I7023a1d6618608c867c31396fa677d3016ca493e
Partial-Bug: #1666009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/33/469933/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def allow_port_physical_network(): """Check if port physical network fields are allowed. Version 1.32 of the API added the physical network field to the port object. """ return (pecan.request.version.minor >= versions.MINOR_32_PORT_PHYSICAL_NETWORK)

Fix double conditional bug

Currently there are two conditional statements
on a single task, so only the last is applied.

commit_message:
Run token flush cron job hourly by default

Running this job once a day has proven problematic for large
deployments as seen in the bug report. Setting it to run hourly
would be an improvement to the current situation, as the flushes
wouldn't need to process as much data.

Note that this only affects people using UUID as the token provider.

Change-Id: I462e4da2bfdbcba0403ecde5d613386938e2283a
Related-Bug: #1649616
(cherry picked from commit 65e643aca2202f031db94f1ccd3d44e195e5e772)

commit_message:
Install openstack-nova-migration on computes during M->N upgrade

The current Newton overcloud-full images include this package but
we need to install it during a major upgrade from Mitaka.

bp tripleo-cold-migration

Change-Id: I1404d3b5d469c0d38788e568736f7e5eb479444f

commit_message:
Ensure yum cache is ready before update

To workaround yum bug with libnss we need to make yum cache
before running update. In fact we should have done this
regardless of the bug.

Change-Id: I5b2355fb8abe3c8d4b9ce9c62b9ffdba8c1e8d9d
Resolves: rhbz#1458841
Closes-Bug: #1703830
(cherry picked from commit 1a544f66a51579180ead9deadc168d2a1a200719)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/27/484827/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Always ensure yum has full cache yum makecache || echo "Yum makecache failed. This can cause failure later on."

subject: OVS firewall: do strip_vlan in TRANSIENT_TABLE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-07 09:53:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3312b78f0c9b70362d27e4dc5497a3c00d120d82', 'message': 'OVS firewall: move strip_vlan action and match dl_vlan

This change moves the strip_vlan action from RULES_INGRESS/82 to
LOCAL_SWITCHING after the point where the traffic from local VM ports
has been moved to BASE_EGRESS. A reason for this move is that strip_vlan is
only needed for traffic *not* coming from VM ports and coming on a patch
port from br-*, and that it is hence simpler do do the strip_vlan in
LOCAL_SWITCHING rather than in mutliple places that also happen to be common
with traffic from local VMs.

This change also addresses another need: I16a35b5d6c54901899d24fc94bd3438c1f1be05e
results in add_flow being possibly done with an Openflow version higher than OF1.0.
The strip_action as currently done is not compatible with OF>1.0, because later
versions require matching on dl_vlan first (the "strip vlan if there is one"
behavior of OF1.0 is not supported anymore). For this reason this change adds
a match on dl_vlan for the strip_vlan rule.

Note that matching dl_dst only in the context of a specific dl_vlan
contributes to addressing bug 1626010.

Change-Id: I76ee34a614237bbc99989ce9c1b96a30456be282
Partial-Bug: 1626010

commit_message:
OVS firewall: do strip_vlan in TRANSIENT_TABLE

This change moves the strip_vlan action from RULES_INGRESS/82 to
TRANSIENT_TABLE after the point where the traffic from local VM ports
has been moved to BASE_EGRESS. A reason for this move is that strip_vlan
is only needed for traffic *not* coming from VM ports and coming on a
patch  port from br-*, and that it is hence simpler do do the strip_vlan
in TRANSIENT_TABLE rather than in mutliple places that also happen to be
common with traffic from local VMs.

This change also addresses another need:
I16a35b5d6c54901899d24fc94bd3438c1f1be05e results in add_flow being
possibly done with an Openflow version higher than OF1.0. The
strip_action as currently done is not compatible with OF>1.0, because
later versions require matching on dl_vlan first (the "strip vlan if
there is one" behavior of OF1.0 is not supported anymore). For this
reason this change adds a match on dl_vlan for the strip_vlan rule.

Change-Id: I76ee34a614237bbc99989ce9c1b96a30456be282

commit_message:
unit: consolidate mocking start_odl_sync_thread

Introduce fixture to mock start_odl_sync_thread.
and mock _start_sync_timer. It's also needs to be mocked
to avoid running timer unintentionally.

Change-Id: I8298189fcbe56028fa08b96cb50f50d5163a58f0

commit_message:
Microversion 2.52 - Support tag when boot

Change-Id: Ib65894f0e128c599db8d3440fe5a8427e62d5782
Depends-On: Ifcaaf285c8f98a1d0e8bbbc87b2f57fbce057346
Implements: blueprint support-tag-instance-when-boot
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/17/484617/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_boot_with_tags(self): self.run_command('boot --flavor 1 --image %s ' 'some-server --tags tag1,tag2' % FAKE_UUID_1, api_version='2.52') self.assert_called_anytime( 'POST', '/servers', {'server': { 'flavorRef': '1', 'name': 'some-server', 'imageRef': FAKE_UUID_1, 'min_count': 1, 'max_count': 1, 'tags': ['tag1', 'tag2'] }}, ) def test_boot_with_tags_pre_v2_52(self): cmd = ('boot --flavor 1 --image %s some-server ' '--tags tag1,tag2' % FAKE_UUID_1) self.assertRaises(exceptions.CommandError, self.run_command, cmd, api_version='2.51')

subject: Disable network validation in multinode jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-11 17:26:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/07d9e9c1a95e06613fc368aff452ae10bac1a555', 'message': "Disable network validation in multinode jobs

Sometimes the infracloud gateway refuses to ping even though
everything else is working fine.  Since we have coverage of this
functionality in the OVB jobs it should be safe to turn it off
here so it stops spuriously failing our jobs.

We can't just set the resource to OS::Heat::None because there
are other resources with dependencies on it.  Instead, this adds
a noop version of the validation software config that always
returns true.

Change-Id: I8361bc8be442b45c3ef6bdccdc53598fcb1d9540
Partial-Bug: 1680167
(cherry picked from commit 766de0cacb18171264d2a699ac48cacb8d35a152)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-11 20:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['ci/environments/scenario004-multinode.yaml', 'ci/environments/scenario001-multinode.yaml', 'ci/environments/scenario002-multinode.yaml', 'ci/common/all-nodes-validation-disabled.yaml', 'ci/environments/scenario003-multinode.yaml', 'ci/environments/multinode.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/8458911e514ed4ee88c17e52bf1ea7b82bdcfb66', 'message': "Disable network validation in multinode jobs

Sometimes the infracloud gateway refuses to ping even though
everything else is working fine.  Since we have coverage of this

here so it stops spuriously failing our jobs.

We can't just set the resource to OS::Heat::None because there
are other resources with dependencies on it.  Instead, this adds
a noop version of the validation software config that always
returns true.

Change-Id: I8361bc8be442b45c3ef6bdccdc53598fcb1d9540
Partial-Bug: 1680167
(cherry picked from commit 766de0cacb18171264d2a699ac48cacb8d35a152)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable network validation in multinode jobs

Sometimes the infracloud gateway refuses to ping even though
everything else is working fine.  Since we have coverage of this
functionality in the OVB jobs it should be safe to turn it off
here so it stops spuriously failing our jobs.

We can't just set the resource to OS::Heat::None because there
are other resources with dependencies on it.  Instead, this adds
a noop version of the validation software config that always
returns true.

Change-Id: I8361bc8be442b45c3ef6bdccdc53598fcb1d9540
Partial-Bug: 1680167
(cherry picked from commit 766de0cacb18171264d2a699ac48cacb8d35a152)

commit_message:
doc: Create directory structure for docs migration

The spec [1] recommends the following sections:

- install
- contributor
- configuration
- cli
- admin
- user
- reference

Only a few of these are useful here:

- contributor
- cli
- user
- reference

Add these and populate them.

[1] specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/pike/os-manuals-migration

Change-Id: I8a9ddcc915f25ebfaa1e994dba6c15883bd2715d

commit_message:
Refactor placement fixtures

Some useful fixtures were created for the ironic inventory changes that
would be handy to be able to access in other functional tests. This
patch doesn't change any logic, but simply moves the fixtures into their
own file.

Blueprint: custom-resource-classes-pike

Change-Id: Ic52103a1ff30710cf2f7ab732935c0c741220494
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/446122/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix variable names in sripts-library.sh

CURL_CMD and OUTPUT_FILE don't exist as variables, we need to use the
specified "GETPIP_CMD" and "GETPIP_FILE" variables.

Change-Id: I3475a9507083ca2721bac7c07321bf9ca509a232

commit_message:
Sort key-value pairs in local_settings dictionaries

The AVAILABLE_THEMES and LAUNCH_INSTANCE_DEFAULTS options are currently
templated as unsorted dictionaries. Sort them to avoid unnecessary
config changes and service restarts.

Change-Id: I7bfd5248be78efa3a87bd56637ea1082d391a3e0

commit_message:
Add python package for ansible bootstrap

In the current ansible bootstrap script, python3 is
exclusively installed resulting in there being no
symlink for /usr/bin/python to the appropriate
python binary. This causes failures for anything
which relies on using the 'python' command (instead
of python3), resulting in failure if the python
packages was not previously installed in some other
way.

Installing the 'python-minimal' package results in
python2 being installed and symlinked, but it does
not cause the Ansible venv to be bootstrapped any
differently - it still uses python3 and the venv
is setup with a symlink from python -> python3.

We therefore include the 'python-minimal' package
in the bootstrap so that anything that needs access
to the python binary can still work. In the future
Ubuntu may change where it symlinks to, but by
then all our tooling should be capable of using
the new python version.

Closes-Bug: #1704546
Change-Id: I13f70040a0a3b4d1c9434078aa6d6888abf45787
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/27/485127/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-14 06:50:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.module.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/a9e68950de33b96dad84f4d107ef1b061a30ae60', 'message': 'Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.

I found an interesting bug in images panel.
In images panel, set filter to be "visibility: public", I got one
image listed in the table, then I changed language from "en" to
"zh_CN" and filter images again, I got none.

In the tab of browser developer tool, I saw a correct response
with one image data, but it was not appeared in the table. Later
I found the attribute "isServer" of visibility filter is false,
that caused the above bug.

Change-Id: I130d07727fe74ce65aba72d3e63fdfe0c8721795
Closes-Bug: #1691683
(cherry picked from commit 3724066224adfe2a82f43bfdc255144b402c7236)
'}]
commit_message:
Attribute "isServer" of images visibility filter should be true.

I found an interesting bug in images panel.
In images panel, set filter to be "visibility: public", I got one
image listed in the table, then I changed language from "en" to
"zh_CN" and filter images again, I got none.

In the tab of browser developer tool, I saw a correct response
with one image data, but it was not appeared in the table. Later
I found the attribute "isServer" of visibility filter is false,
that caused the above bug.

Change-Id: I130d07727fe74ce65aba72d3e63fdfe0c8721795
Closes-Bug: #1691683
(cherry picked from commit 3724066224adfe2a82f43bfdc255144b402c7236)
